common_issues.title: PiecesOS Processing Errors and Crashes
common_issues.description: Users are reporting processing errors ("Something went wrong with processing...") and application crashes when uploading files. These issues appear related to recent rate limiting changes and potential file incompatibilities. Temporary solutions involve manual exemptions and app restarts. Developers are working on long-term fixes, including improved error messages and authentication for cloud processing.

related_issues.title: I´m sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app
related_issues.text:
I´m sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please wait a few seconds and try again, or contact support@pieces.app
### Software

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.13

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

[com.pieces.pfd.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17891327/com.pieces.pfd.zip)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c9a6f930-4d30-41ad-8d70-b81d9c3f7e6f)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/99d91958-8fb7-4f27-9efa-9d628127e90f)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d1c630b-816c-488d-87f9-202a86d63820)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e8278a0-eca0-4b4e-bcaa-a5b195da5562)

## Summary of GitHub Issue: Rate Limiting in PiecesOS 
**Key Points Raised:**
* Users experiencing error messages related to processing.
* Issue began after recent rate limiting changes in PiecesOS. 

**Problems Identified:**
* Rate limiting causing unnecessary restrictions for legitimate users. 
* Lack of clear error messages leading to user confusion.
* No readily available solutions for non-technical users. 

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* Manual exemption from rate limiting for affected users through contact with developer.
* Upgraded error message with infrastructure update planned.
* Authentication requirement for cloud processing in the future. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* Issue mostly resolved with manual adjustments.
* Long-term solution still under development.

**Outstanding Concerns:**
* Lack of alternative solutions for users experiencing difficulties with manual exemption process.
* Impact of future authentication requirement for cloud processing.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary:

**Key Points Raised:**

* @omkar-4 reported an issue where PiecesOS crashes when starting the Pieces for Devs Desktop App. 
* The user is experiencing this issue with specific files/folders used as context.
* The issue is difficult to reproduce without specific files/folders.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS crashes when starting the app due to incompatibility with specific files/folders used as context.
* The source of the issue is difficult to pinpoint without reproducing the error with the specific files/folders.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces requested access to the specific files/folders causing the issue to facilitate troubleshooting and identify the root cause.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user has not yet responded with the requested files/folders.
* The issue remains unresolved until the user provides the requested information.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue may be related to previous reports of crashes with file/folder contexts.
* The user is encouraged to consult existing issues, documentation, and the YouTube channel for further assistance.

This summary highlights the key points of the conversation, focusing on the specific issue, troubleshooting steps, and current status. It provides a concise overview of the situation without including unnecessary details.

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

If the model is 4o Mini, everything works fine.
No comments found on this issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS users report issues with LLM engine
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties with the LLM engine in Pieces OS, including problems downloading and activating local models, as well as enabling the long-term memory feature. Troubleshooting steps include restarting the application, checking network connectivity, and ensuring software is up-to-date. The Pieces team is actively working on solutions and recommends users update to the latest version for potential fixes.

related_issues.title: Manually downloading a LLM
related_issues.text:
Manually downloading a LLM
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I am attempting to install Pieces with a local LLM. Unfortunately, I have an unstable network connection (which is why I want a local model in the first place.) I am trying to get Mistral-7B.

I found that Pieces wants to download the whole model (4 GB) all at once. If it fails for whatever reason, it restarts from the beginning.  This is annoying and it makes downloading virtually impossible, because my network connection does not stay long enough to pull 4GB in one go.

I have figured out where the file is being downloaded to and from, and managed to download it manually with wget. Now the problem is that Pieces refuses to recognize it. Even if I put it in the right place, the Pieces app stil shows the Download button in the UI, and clicking Download truncates the file to zero and starts the download from the beginning.

I tried to edit models.db and change "downloaded" to true in the relevant line, but it has no effect.

Is there anything else I could do?
## Summary of GitHub conversation about importing downloaded models into Pieces

**Key points:**

* Importing manually downloaded models isn't currently supported due to potential corruption issues and integration challenges.
* Pieces automatically deletes partially downloaded models due to uncertainty about their integrity.
* A workaround involving adding an "download_success.txt" file and restarting might work until a permanent solution is available.

**Problems identified:**

* Manually imported models might be corrupted.
* Partial downloads get deleted, making completion difficult.

**Proposed/implemented solutions:**

* A new release with improved on-device LLM infrastructure, including the ability to resume failed downloads, is coming soon.
* A temporary workaround involving adding a file and restarting is provided.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue of importing downloaded models remains unresolved, but a fix is expected in the próximos días.
* Users can try the workaround in the meantime.

related_issues.title: Can't turn on long term memory engine
related_issues.text:
Can't turn on long term memory engine
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

i keep clicking on the button but the ltm engine wont turn on
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d91ee8ce-b8e1-4f28-9785-02d488d88775)

## GitHub Issue Summary: LTM Engine Not Working

**Key Points:**

* User `sh02sahil` reported LTM engine not working, despite restarting and trying both local and cloud modes.
* `mason-at-pieces` confirmed baseline troubleshooting steps (restart, checking mode).
* `mark-at-pieces` identified the issue:
    * Known problem with potential fix in upcoming release.
    * Desktop application breaking change required for compatibility (version 11.0.0).
    * Solution:
        * Update to latest release (may fix the issue).
        * Update desktop app to 11.0.0 if the issue persists.
        * Schedule consultation if update fails.

**Current Status:**

* User waiting for update to become available.
* Will test and report outcome after update.

**Outcome:**

* Pending user's report after testing the update. 
* Further troubleshooting may be needed depending on the results.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 10.1.15 Bugs and Issues
common_issues.description: Multiple users report issues with Pieces OS 10.1.15, including LTM engine activation failures and app crashes.  Updating to the latest release or version 11.0.0, if available, is recommended.  Contact support if issues persist.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers app keeps crashing continuously on attempts to upload files and folder and needs restart on my windows 11 laptop
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary:

**Key Points Raised:**

* @omkar-4 reported an issue where PiecesOS crashes when starting the Pieces for Devs Desktop App. 
* The user is experiencing this issue with specific files/folders used as context.
* The issue is difficult to reproduce without specific files/folders.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS crashes when starting the app due to incompatibility with specific files/folders used as context.
* The source of the issue is difficult to pinpoint without reproducing the error with the specific files/folders.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces requested access to the specific files/folders causing the issue to facilitate troubleshooting and identify the root cause.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user has not yet responded with the requested files/folders.
* The issue remains unresolved until the user provides the requested information.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue may be related to previous reports of crashes with file/folder contexts.
* The user is encouraged to consult existing issues, documentation, and the YouTube channel for further assistance.

This summary highlights the key points of the conversation, focusing on the specific issue, troubleshooting steps, and current status. It provides a concise overview of the situation without including unnecessary details.

recommendations: **Prioritize 'PiecesOS Processing Errors and Crashes'**: This issue has the highest frequency and a very active ticket (#471). Focus on implementing the long-term fixes for rate limiting and file incompatibilities to reduce its occurrence.

**Improve LLM Engine Stability and Usability**: Address the difficulties users face with the LLM engine, particularly downloading/activating local models and enabling long-term memory. This will resolve issues like those in tickets #527, #528, and #526.

**Enhance Error Messages and Troubleshooting**: Provide clearer error messages to users, especially for processing errors and LLM issues. Offer more detailed troubleshooting steps in the app and potentially through a dedicated knowledge base.

**Gather More Data on Crashes**:  Ticket #507 highlights the need for more information to reproduce and debug crashes. Explore ways to collect more detailed crash reports from the desktop application.

**Proactive Communication**:  Consider a communication to users acknowledging the recent issues and outlining the steps being taken to address them. This can help manage expectations and reduce support ticket volume.
